column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: In FY23, we undertook a comprehensive review of APAÃ¢ÂÂs current suite of digital systems to support the business processes stipulated by the HSEH Management System, identifying the key areas where improvements in our digital systems are necessary to support our HSEH Strategy over a five-year horizon. The roadmap identified seven key areas where significant improvements were required over the next five years: A mobile-enabled digital tool for employees and contractors, integrated digital HSEH Incident, Near Miss and Hazard Management System, and new HSEH reporting and analytical framework supporting current and future digital tools.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: APA received one regulatory (safety) penalty infringement notice and 20 regulatory (safety) improvement notices in FY23. Workplace Health and Safety Queensland issued the infringement notice on an APA contractor undertaking electrical repairs on several inverters at our Dugald River Solar Farm without the appropriate electrical licences. \t
column14: It resulted in a $2,000 penalty. The same Regulator issued the 20 improvement notices during an inspection at the Dugald River Solar Farm. All messages were related to minor administrative matters at the site and were promptly rectified.
column20: Penalty, Regulatory Improvement, Electrical License

column13: The FY23 Assurance Schedule focused on APAÃ¢ÂÂs critical risks linked to our Fatal Risk Protocols. This schedule was designed to measure the effectiveness of critical risks across various APA operations.
column14: In FY23, 17 Line 2 assurance HSEH Management System activities were undertaken according to the schedule. It included auditing 1,332 controls, resulting in an overall compliance rating of 97% across all assessed areas.

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships

Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: Our commitment is to providing and fostering an inclusive and respectful workplace with safe, fair, and positive working conditions. APA has zero tolerance for any form of harmful behaviour, including unlawful discrimination, bullying, harassment, sexual harassment, sex-based harassment, defamation, victimisation and other inappropriate behaviour.
